tooltip.title: Template Code
tooltip.content: Auto-generated unique code (e.g., SCRUTINY_TEMPLATE_123456). Used for referencing in automation and reports. Click sparkle icon to regenerate.

fields.label: Template Title
fields.explanation: Descriptive name shown in template lists

tooltip.title: Template Title
tooltip.content: Human-friendly name that appears in selection lists. Use clear, descriptive titles like 'GST Scrutiny Response Letter' or 'Demand Notice Reply'.

tooltip.title: Case Stage
tooltip.content: The litigation stage this template is designed for. Templates are organized and filtered by stage for easier discovery.

tooltip.title: Template Version
tooltip.content: Version number tracks template changes. System automatically increments when you save modifications.

fields.label: Visibility
fields.explanation: Who can see and use this template

tooltip.title: Template Visibility
tooltip.content: Admin: Only administrators. Team: All team members. All: Everyone including clients (use with caution).

tooltip.title: Template Editor
tooltip.content: Create document content with rich formatting. Use toolbar for bold, italic, lists, tables, alignment. Insert {{variables}} from the sidebar.

fields.label: Insert Variables
fields.explanation: Dynamic fields auto-filled from case data

tooltip.title: Variable Library
tooltip.content: Click any variable to insert into your template. Variables like {{client_name}} or {{case_number}} are replaced with actual data when generating documents.

fields.label: Field Library
fields.explanation: Available data fields from your system

tooltip.title: Field Library
tooltip.content: Pre-defined fields from your case management system. Click + to add fields to your template and automatically insert them into the editor.

tooltip.title: Add Field to Template
tooltip.content: Adds the field to your template's field list and inserts the variable into the editor at cursor position.

tooltip.title: Company Logo
tooltip.content: Upload your firm's logo (PNG, JPG, max 2MB). Appears in document header when enabled. Recommended size: 200x80px.

fields.label: Header Text
fields.explanation: Text appearing at top of every page

tooltip.title: Document Header
tooltip.content: Text displayed at the top of every page. Typically includes firm name and practice area. Shows below logo if uploaded.

fields.label: Footer Text
fields.explanation: Text appearing at bottom of every page

tooltip.title: Document Footer
tooltip.content: Text displayed at the bottom of every page. Common uses: confidentiality notices, firm contact info, disclaimer.

tooltip.title: Document Watermark
tooltip.content: Enable to display 'CONFIDENTIAL' watermark diagonally across pages. Adjust opacity slider to control visibility (10-50% recommended).

tooltip.title: Document Font
tooltip.content: Choose the font for your document. Inter and Roboto are recommended for professional legal documents. Font applies to all body text.

fields.label: Brand Colors
fields.explanation: Primary and accent colors for document

tooltip.title: Brand Colors
tooltip.content: Primary color: Used for headers and important elements. Accent color: Used for highlights and secondary elements. Pick colors matching your firm's branding.

tooltip.title: Output Format
tooltip.content: PDF: Best for final documents, cannot be edited. DOCX: Editable Word format. HTML: Web-viewable format. PDF is recommended for legal documents.

tooltip.title: Page Size
tooltip.content: A4: International standard (210x297mm). Letter: US standard (8.5x11in). Legal: US legal size (8.5x14in). Choose based on your jurisdiction.

tooltip.title: Page Orientation
tooltip.content: Portrait: Standard vertical orientation for most documents. Landscape: Horizontal orientation, useful for wide tables or charts.

tooltip.title: Page Margins
tooltip.content: Set margins in millimeters for each edge. Standard: 20mm all sides. Wider margins (25-30mm) provide more white space for binding or notes.

tooltip.title: Header/Footer Options
tooltip.content: Toggle to include/exclude header, footer, and page numbers. Disable for shorter documents or when not needed.

tooltip.title: Filename Pattern
tooltip.content: Use variables to create dynamic filenames. Example: ${code}_${case.caseNumber}_${now:YYYYMMDD}.pdf generates 'SCRUTINY_GST001_20251012.pdf'. Variables: ${code}, ${case.caseNumber}, ${now:format}.

tooltip.title: DOCX Template Upload
tooltip.content: Upload existing Word templates with {{placeholder}} variables (max 10MB). System detects variables and maps them to case data fields. Preserves formatting.

tooltip.title: JSON Import/Export
tooltip.content: Export: Download template as JSON for backup or sharing. Import: Restore template from JSON file. Useful for template versioning and team collaboration.

tooltip.title: Save Template
tooltip.content: Saves template to your library. Required fields: Template Code, Title, Stage. Template becomes available for document generation immediately.

buttons.label: Preview
buttons.explanation: See how document looks with sample data

tooltip.title: Preview Document
tooltip.content: Renders template with mock case data to show final appearance. All {{variables}} are replaced with sample values. Check formatting before saving.

tooltip.title: Generate Template Code
tooltip.content: Automatically creates unique template code based on stage and timestamp. Recommended to ensure no conflicts with existing templates.

features.label: Template Builder 2.0
features.explanation: Unified interface for creating all template types

tooltip.title: Template Builder 2.0
tooltip.content: All-in-one tool for creating rich text templates, field-based forms, or importing DOCX files. Features visual editor, variable library, branding controls, and output settings in a single workflow.

tooltip.title: Document GST Case Progress
tooltip.content: Record specific work done for this GST litigation task. Include form references when relevant (e.g., 'ASMT-10 reply drafted addressing 3 key objections', 'DRC-01 review completed - liability confirmed at ₹2.4L', 'Form GSTR-9C reconciliation in progress'). Be detailed enough for handoff to other team members.

accessibility.ariaLabel: Enter progress remarks for GST case

fields.label: Outcome
fields.explanation: Current status of this GST work activity

tooltip.title: Outcome Types for GST Cases
tooltip.content: Progressing: GST work moving forward smoothly (e.g., reply drafting on track). Blocked: Cannot proceed due to external factors (e.g., awaiting client GSTR data). Completed: This GST work item is finished (e.g., notice reply filed). Need Support: Require help from team (e.g., section reference verification). Pending Input: Waiting for client/department response (e.g., missing GST invoices).

accessibility.ariaLabel: Select outcome type for GST work

fields.label: Task Status
fields.explanation: Update the overall GST task progress state

tooltip.title: GST Task Status Updates
tooltip.content: Updates the parent GST task's current state. Not Started: No work begun on GST matter. In Progress: Actively working on GST case (e.g., drafting ASMT-10 reply). Review: GST work ready for partner review. Completed: GST task fully finished (e.g., appeal filed). Overdue: Passed GST authority deadline. Updates reflect in task lists and GST dashboards.

fields.label: Hours Worked
fields.explanation: Time spent on this GST activity (optional)

tooltip.title: Time Tracking for GST Work
tooltip.content: Record time spent on GST case in hours (e.g., 0.25 = 15 mins for quick notice review, 1.5 = 1hr 30mins for detailed ASMT-10 reply). Used for GST matter billing, workload analysis, and project time estimation. Leave blank if time tracking not required. Maximum 24 hours per entry.

accessibility.ariaLabel: Enter hours worked on GST case

fields.label: Work Date
fields.explanation: When was this GST work performed?

tooltip.title: GST Work Date vs Entry Date
tooltip.content: Date when GST work was actually performed (defaults to today). Use this to log GST work from previous days (up to 30 days back) - e.g., backdating hearing attendance or client meeting. Important for accurate GST billing and compliance tracking. The system records entry date separately for audit purposes.

fields.label: Next Follow-Up Date
fields.explanation: Schedule when to check this GST task again (optional)

tooltip.title: GST Follow-Up Reminders
tooltip.content: Set a future date when this GST task needs attention again (e.g., DRC-07 submission deadline, hearing date preparation reminder). Creates a reminder for the assigned person. Use quick buttons (Tomorrow, 3 days, 1 week) for common intervals. Leave blank if no specific GST follow-up needed. Appears in 'Pending GST Follow-ups' dashboard.

fields.label: Next Actions
fields.explanation: What GST work needs to be done next? (optional)

tooltip.title: Defining Next Steps in GST Cases
tooltip.content: Outline specific GST actions required to move task forward. Examples: 'Schedule client meeting to discuss GST liability implications', 'Draft response to objections 4-7 in ASMT-10 notice', 'Obtain partner approval for Section 73 defence strategy', 'Prepare annexures for DRC-01 submission'. Helps GST team members pick up where you left off.

accessibility.ariaLabel: Enter next actions for GST case

tooltip.title: GST Case Blockers
tooltip.content: Document obstacles preventing GST case progress. Examples: 'Waiting for client to provide GSTR-1 data for period April-June 2024', 'Need GST department clarification on Section 73 applicability', 'Missing Form DRC-01 acknowledgement from portal', 'Tax consultant unavailable until hearing date'. Helps identify bottlenecks in GST workflows and prioritize resolution.

accessibility.ariaLabel: Enter GST case blockers or issues

fields.label: Support Needed
fields.explanation: Mark if you need GST team assistance

tooltip.title: Request GST Team Support
tooltip.content: Flags the task on the Team Dashboard to request assistance on GST matter (e.g., section reference check for ASMT-10 reply, annexure preparation for DRC-07, GST portal navigation help). Task creator and team leads receive notification. Use for technical GST questions or workload assistance.

fields.label: Request Escalation
fields.explanation: Alert task creator about critical GST issues

tooltip.title: GST Case Escalation
tooltip.content: Notifies the task creator for urgent attention on GST matter (e.g., DRC-07 due date risk, missed hearing date correction needed, client non-cooperation affecting GST compliance). Sends immediate notification. Task marked with red flag. Use for critical GST deadline risks or client emergencies.

fields.label: Client Communication
fields.explanation: Mark if you contacted client about GST case

tooltip.title: GST Client Communication Tracking
tooltip.content: Check when you have contacted client (call/email/meeting) about GST matter. Logs a touchpoint on case timeline for GST engagement tracking. Examples: 'Discussed GST liability implications', 'Explained ASMT-10 notice objections', 'Requested missing GSTR-1 data'. Shows phone icon on timeline.

fields.label: Internal Review
fields.explanation: Mark if GST work was peer-reviewed

tooltip.title: GST Quality Assurance
tooltip.content: Mark when peer/partner has completed internal review (quality badge) before submitting GST reply/appeal. Examples: 'Partner reviewed ASMT-10 reply', 'Senior reviewed Section 73 defence strategy', 'Quality check on DRC-07 calculations'. Indicates GST work met internal standards.

tooltip.title: Progress Section
tooltip.content: Core section for recording work performed. Remarks field is required (min 20 chars) and forms the main record of progress. Outcome and Status updates provide at-a-glance health indicators for dashboards and reports.

tooltip.title: Time Tracking & Scheduling
tooltip.content: Log hours worked for billing and analytics. Set work date if logging past work (up to 30 days). Schedule next follow-up to create automatic reminders. All fields optional but recommended for accurate project tracking.

tooltip.title: Next Actions & Blockers
tooltip.content: Define clear next steps so anyone can continue work. Document blockers to make issues visible to management. Both fields optional but highly recommended for team coordination and project continuity.

tooltip.title: Follow-Up Flags
tooltip.content: Four optional flags for specific scenarios: Support Needed (team help), Escalation (urgent issues to creator), Client Interaction (contact logged), Internal Review (QA completed). Each triggers specific workflows and notifications. Use strategically.

buttons.label: Add Follow-Up
buttons.explanation: Save this follow-up to task history

tooltip.title: Save Follow-Up
tooltip.content: Saves follow-up entry to task history. Updates task status if changed. Sends notifications based on flags (escalation, support needed). Creates next follow-up reminder if date set. Disabled until remarks field has 20+ characters.

features.label: Add New Follow-Up
features.explanation: Record progress, track time, and coordinate with team

tooltip.title: Follow-Up System Overview
tooltip.content: Follow-ups create a detailed activity log for each task. Required: Progress remarks (20+ chars) and status update. Optional: Time tracking, next actions, blockers, and coordination flags. All entries timestamped and attributed to you. Visible in task timeline and analytics.

tooltip.title: Role Name
tooltip.content: Enter a descriptive name for this role (e.g., 'Senior Advocate', 'Tax Manager'). This name appears in role assignment dropdowns and access reports.

fields.label: Role Description
fields.explanation: Explain the purpose and scope of this role

tooltip.title: Role Description
tooltip.content: Describe who should have this role and what access it provides. This helps administrators choose the correct role when assigning to users.

fields.label: Data Scope
fields.explanation: Controls what data users with this role can see

tooltip.title: Data Visibility Scope
tooltip.content: Own Cases: See only cases assigned to you. Team Cases: See cases for you and your direct reports. All Cases: See all cases in the organization. Choose based on the role's organizational level.

fields.label: Module Access
fields.explanation: Select modules this role can access

tooltip.title: Module Access Control
tooltip.content: Check modules that should appear in the sidebar for this role. Unchecked modules are completely hidden. Users cannot navigate to restricted modules even with direct URLs.

fields.label: Permission Level
fields.explanation: Base permission set for this role

tooltip.title: Permission Level
tooltip.content: Admin: Full access to all features. Manager: Can manage team and create records. Staff: Standard CRUD operations. Viewer: Read-only access. Custom: Define specific permissions below.

buttons.label: Create Role
buttons.explanation: Add a new role to the system

tooltip.title: Create New Role
tooltip.content: Opens the role creation form. Define name, description, data scope, and permissions. New roles are immediately available for user assignment.

buttons.label: Clone Role
buttons.explanation: Copy an existing role as starting point

tooltip.title: Clone Existing Role
tooltip.content: Creates a duplicate of the selected role with all its permissions. Modify the copy to create similar roles quickly. Original role remains unchanged.

tooltip.title: Permission Matrix View
tooltip.content: Opens a grid showing all roles vs all permissions. Quickly identify gaps or overlaps in access control. Export matrix for audit documentation.

tooltip.title: Authority Name
tooltip.content: Enter the full official name (e.g., 'Gujarat High Court', 'Customs, Excise and Service Tax Appellate Tribunal - Ahmedabad'). Use official designations for consistency.

tooltip.title: Authority Code
tooltip.content: Short alphanumeric code for quick reference (e.g., 'GHC', 'CESTAT-AHM'). Used in case numbers and internal references. Must be unique across all authorities.

tooltip.title: Authority Level
tooltip.content: Select the tier in the legal hierarchy: Supreme Court → High Court → Tribunal → Appellate Authority → Adjudicating Authority. Determines appeal routing and deadline rules.

tooltip.title: Jurisdiction
tooltip.content: Define the territorial jurisdiction: National, State-specific, or Zone-specific. Used to match cases to correct authorities based on client location.

fields.label: Bench Location
fields.explanation: Physical location where the authority sits

tooltip.title: Bench Location
tooltip.content: City and address where hearings are conducted. Some authorities have multiple bench locations (e.g., CESTAT has benches in multiple cities). Add each bench separately.

fields.label: Matter Types
fields.explanation: Case categories handled by this authority

tooltip.title: Matter Types
tooltip.content: Select case types this authority handles (e.g., GST, Customs, Income Tax). Filters case creation options based on selected authority. Multiple selections allowed.

tooltip.title: Add New Authority
tooltip.content: Opens form to add a new court, tribunal, or statutory authority. All required fields must be completed. Authority becomes available for case assignment immediately.

tooltip.title: View Legal Hierarchy
tooltip.content: Opens visual tree diagram showing the appellate structure. See how authorities connect in the appeal chain. Useful for understanding case progression paths.

tooltip.title: Judge Name
tooltip.content: Enter full name with appropriate honorific (e.g., 'Hon'ble Justice A.B. Sharma', 'Shri M.K. Patel, Member (Technical)'). Use official designations as per court records.

tooltip.title: Designation
tooltip.content: Current designation (e.g., 'Chief Justice', 'Member (Judicial)', 'Additional Commissioner'). Update when designation changes. Historical designations tracked in profile history.

tooltip.title: Authority Assignment
tooltip.content: Select the court or tribunal where this judge currently sits. A judge may be assigned to multiple benches within the same authority. Select primary assignment here.

tooltip.title: Judge Specialization
tooltip.content: Select areas of expertise: Tax Law, Constitutional Law, Commercial Law, etc. Helps match cases to benches. Multiple selections allowed. Based on known case history and background.

tooltip.title: Bench Assignment
tooltip.content: Select bench(es) where this judge currently sits. Include effective dates. Judges may sit on multiple benches (e.g., Single Bench, Division Bench). Track all current assignments.

tooltip.title: Add New Judge
tooltip.content: Opens form to create a new judge profile. Complete basic information and authority assignment. Additional details like specialization and bench assignments can be added later.

buttons.label: View Cases
buttons.explanation: See cases presided by this judge

tooltip.title: View Case History
tooltip.content: Opens list of all cases where this judge has presided. Filter by date range, case type, or outcome. Useful for understanding judge's past rulings and preferences.

tooltip.title: Employee Name
tooltip.content: Enter full legal name as it should appear in system. This name is used in case assignments, document signatures, and all official correspondence.

fields.label: Email Address
fields.explanation: Primary work email for login and notifications

tooltip.title: Work Email
tooltip.content: Enter official work email. This becomes the login username and receives all system notifications. Must be unique across all employees. Cannot be changed after creation.

tooltip.title: Employee Role
tooltip.content: Select operational role: Partner/CA, Manager, Advocate, Staff. Determines default permissions and recommended data scope. Can differ from RBAC role for specialized access.

fields.label: Data Scope
fields.explanation: What cases can this employee see?

tooltip.title: Data Visibility Scope
tooltip.content: Own Cases: Only cases where they are assigned. Team Cases: Cases for them and their direct reports. All Cases: Organization-wide visibility. Recommended defaults: Partner→All, Manager→Team, Staff→Own.

tooltip.title: Reporting Manager
tooltip.content: Select the employee's direct manager. This creates the team hierarchy used for 'Team Cases' visibility. Manager sees cases of all their direct and indirect reports.

fields.label: Module Access
fields.explanation: Which modules can this employee access?

tooltip.title: Module Access Configuration
tooltip.content: Select modules visible in sidebar for this employee. Unselected modules are hidden and inaccessible. Overrides role-based defaults. Admin/Partner roles bypass restrictions.

tooltip.title: Default Task Category
tooltip.content: Pre-selects this category when employee creates tasks. Used for billing classification. Categories: Advisory, Litigation, Compliance, etc. Can be overridden per task.

tooltip.title: Add New Employee
tooltip.content: Opens employee creation form. Required: Name, Email, Role. Sends invitation email to the employee. They must complete signup to activate account.

tooltip.title: Organization Chart
tooltip.content: Opens interactive visualization of the reporting hierarchy. Click nodes to view employee details. Drag to rearrange. Export as image for documentation.

buttons.label: Configure Access
buttons.explanation: Set data scope and module permissions

tooltip.title: Access Configuration
tooltip.content: Opens detailed access settings panel. Configure data scope, module access, and special permissions. Changes take effect on employee's next login.

tooltip.title: Event Type
tooltip.content: Select the type of event: Notice Received, Order Passed, Appeal Filed, etc. Each event type has predefined statutory time limits. System calculates deadline automatically.

fields.label: Base Date
fields.explanation: Date from which deadline is calculated

tooltip.title: Base Date for Calculation
tooltip.content: The date when the triggering event occurred (e.g., date notice was received, date order was passed). Deadline is calculated by adding statutory days to this date.

tooltip.title: Statutory Time Limit
tooltip.content: Number of days allowed by statute (e.g., 30 days for reply to notice, 90 days for appeal to Tribunal). Pre-filled based on event type but can be overridden for special cases.

tooltip.title: Deadline Calculation
tooltip.content: Auto-calculated: Base Date + Statutory Days, adjusted for court holidays and weekends if configured. This is the final due date. Can be extended if extension is granted.

tooltip.title: Extended Deadline
tooltip.content: New deadline after extension is granted. Overrides calculated deadline. Document extension reason and approval in remarks. Track extension count for compliance.

tooltip.title: Relevant Authority
tooltip.content: Select the authority where filing/response is due. Different authorities may have different statutory limits for same event type. Used for jurisdiction-specific deadline rules.

buttons.label: Add Event Type
buttons.explanation: Create a new statutory event configuration

tooltip.title: Add Event Type
tooltip.content: Opens form to define new event type with statutory time limits. Configure default days, authority-specific overrides, and alert thresholds.

tooltip.title: Calculate Deadline
tooltip.content: Triggers deadline calculation based on entered event type and base date. Shows preview with any holiday adjustments before saving.

tooltip.title: Record Extension
tooltip.content: Opens form to record an extension granted by authority. Enter new deadline, reason, and approval reference. Updates deadline status and sends notifications.

tooltip.title: Deadline Alert Configuration
tooltip.content: Configure when reminders are sent: e.g., 7 days before, 3 days before, 1 day before. Set recipients and notification channels (email, SMS, in-app).

fields.label: Search Users
fields.explanation: Find employees by name or email

tooltip.title: Search Employee Directory
tooltip.content: Search by name, email, or designation. Partial matches work. Only active employees appear by default - use Status filter to include inactive. Example: 'Priya' or 'priya@firm.com'.

tooltip.title: Employee Status Filter
tooltip.content: Active: Currently employed, can log in. Inactive: Former employees or on leave - cannot log in but retain historical role data for audit purposes. All: Shows everyone.

fields.label: Role Filter
fields.explanation: Show only users with specific role

tooltip.title: Filter by Assigned Role
tooltip.content: Shows only users who have the selected role assigned. Useful for auditing role distribution - e.g., 'How many people have admin access?' or 'Who are all the managers?'

tooltip.title: System Role Name
tooltip.content: Lowercase with underscores only (e.g., 'senior_tax_manager'). Used in code and database. Cannot be changed after creation. Keep it short and descriptive.

tooltip.title: Role Display Name
tooltip.content: The name shown in UI and reports (e.g., 'Senior Tax Manager'). Can contain spaces and mixed case. This is what users see when viewing role assignments.

tooltip.title: Role Description
tooltip.content: Explain who should have this role and what it enables. Example: 'For senior tax professionals handling complex GST litigation. Includes full case access and report generation.' Helps future admins understand the role's purpose.

fields.label: Data Scope
fields.explanation: Controls which records user can see

tooltip.title: Data Visibility Scope
tooltip.content: CRITICAL SETTING: Own Cases = Only records assigned to this user. Team Cases = Records of user + their direct/indirect reports (requires hierarchy setup). All Cases = Every record in organization. ⚠️ Changes take effect immediately on next page load.
tooltip.securityWarning: Setting 'All Cases' allows seeing confidential matters for all clients. Use with caution.

tooltip.title: Reporting Relationship
tooltip.content: Select this employee's direct manager. CRITICAL for 'Team Cases' scope: Managers can see all cases of their reports. Leave empty only for top-level partners. Affects Team Hierarchy visualization.

tooltip.title: Permission Assignment
tooltip.content: Check to grant this permission to the role. Permissions combine across roles - user gets union of all assigned role permissions. Format: [module].[action] (e.g., cases.edit, documents.delete).

tooltip.title: Module Access Control
tooltip.content: When enabled: Module appears in sidebar, user can navigate to it. When disabled: Module hidden from sidebar AND direct URL access blocked. Users see 'Access Denied' if they try direct URL.

fields.label: Linked Client
fields.explanation: Client entity this portal user represents

tooltip.title: Portal Client Link
tooltip.content: CRITICAL: Select the Client entity this portal user belongs to. Portal user can ONLY see cases linked to this client. Double-check selection - wrong client exposes confidential data.

tooltip.title: Portal Login Email
tooltip.content: Email address the client contact will use to log in. Invitation email sent here. VERIFY this email belongs to actual client contact before sending - prevents data breach from wrong recipient.

fields.label: Portal Access Level
fields.explanation: What client can see in portal

tooltip.title: Portal Access Level
tooltip.content: View Documents: Download documents marked 'Portal Visible'. View Hearings: See hearing schedule and details. Full Access: Complete case overview, documents, hearings, and messaging. Choose minimum needed.

tooltip.title: Synchronize Roles
tooltip.content: Copies role assignments from Employee Master to RBAC system. Use after bulk employee import or if roles appear out of sync. Safe to run multiple times. May take a few minutes for large organizations.

tooltip.title: Refresh Data
tooltip.content: Reloads all role, permission, and assignment data from the database. Use after another admin makes changes, or if data appears stale.

tooltip.title: Create Custom Role
tooltip.content: Opens form to define a new role. Enter system name (lowercase_underscores), display name, and description. ⚠️ New roles start with ZERO permissions - you must edit permissions after creation.
tooltip.securityWarning: Consider cloning existing role instead of starting empty to avoid forgetting critical permissions.

tooltip.title: Edit Role Permissions
tooltip.content: Opens permission editor showing all modules and actions. Check/uncheck to grant/revoke permissions. ⚠️ Changes affect ALL users with this role IMMEDIATELY on their next page load.
tooltip.securityWarning: Never grant 'rbac.admin' permission to non-admin roles - allows privilege escalation.

tooltip.title: Delete Custom Role
tooltip.content: IRREVERSIBLE: Permanently removes this custom role. All users with this role lose associated permissions. System roles (admin, partner, etc.) cannot be deleted.
tooltip.securityWarning: Cannot be undone. Ensure users have alternative role assignments before deleting.

buttons.label: Assign Role [+]
buttons.explanation: Add a role to this user

tooltip.title: Assign Role to User
tooltip.content: Opens role selector to add a role to this user. Users can have multiple roles - permissions combine (most permissive wins). Assignment takes effect on user's next page load.

tooltip.title: Remove Role from User
tooltip.content: Immediately removes this role from the user. They lose associated permissions on next page load. ⚠️ Removing all roles effectively locks user out of system.
tooltip.securityWarning: User may lose access to work they're currently viewing.

tooltip.title: Preview Effective Permissions
tooltip.content: Opens modal showing all permissions this user has across all their assigned roles. Useful for troubleshooting 'why can't user X do Y' issues. Shows combined permissions from all roles.

tooltip.title: Expand Hierarchy
tooltip.content: Expands all nodes in the organization chart to show the complete reporting structure. Useful for screenshots, documentation, or full hierarchy review.

tooltip.title: Collapse Hierarchy
tooltip.content: Collapses all nodes to show only top-level employees. Use to simplify view when focusing on specific branches.

tooltip.title: Invite Client to Portal
tooltip.content: Opens form to create portal access. Select client, enter email, choose access level. Sends invitation email. ⚠️ VERIFY email belongs to actual client contact before sending.
tooltip.securityWarning: Wrong email sends confidential case access to wrong person.

tooltip.title: Toggle Portal Access
tooltip.content: Enable: Client can log in and view their cases. Disable: Blocks login but preserves account for future reactivation. Better than delete for temporary suspension.

tooltip.title: Delete Portal User
tooltip.content: IRREVERSIBLE: Permanently removes portal account. Client loses all access immediately. Use for case closure or client offboarding. Consider deactivation instead if temporary.
tooltip.securityWarning: Cannot be undone. Client will need new invitation to regain access.

buttons.label: Select All
buttons.explanation: Grant all permissions in this section

tooltip.title: Select All Permissions
tooltip.content: Checks all permission checkboxes in the current module or section. Use for full-access roles. ⚠️ Review carefully before saving - grants complete access to this module.
tooltip.securityWarning: Granting all permissions may include sensitive actions like delete or manage.

buttons.label: Clear All
buttons.explanation: Remove all permissions in this section

tooltip.title: Clear All Permissions
tooltip.content: Unchecks all permission checkboxes in the current module or section. Use when starting fresh or removing access to an entire module.

features.label: Data Visibility Rule
features.explanation: How data scope affects record visibility

tooltip.title: Understanding Data Visibility
tooltip.content: Document, Task, and Hearing visibility is automatically inherited from Case visibility scope. Role permissions only control WHAT ACTIONS users can perform (view/create/edit/delete), not WHICH RECORDS they can see. Data scope determines visibility.
tooltip.example: User with 'documents.view' permission and 'Own Cases' scope can only view documents attached to their own cases - not documents from other users' cases.

tooltip.title: Access Chain Inspector
tooltip.content: Shows selected employee's complete access profile: Role, Data Scope, Direct Reports, and counts of Cases/Clients/Tasks they can access. Use to troubleshoot visibility issues or verify access configuration.

tooltip.title: Organization Statistics
tooltip.content: Quick metrics: Total Employees (active), Managers (have reports), Hierarchy Levels (depth), Avg Team Size (reports per manager). Use to validate organization structure is correctly configured.

fields.label: Maximum File Upload Size
fields.explanation: Limits individual file uploads in MB

tooltip.title: Maximum File Upload Size (MB)
tooltip.content: Limits individual file uploads. Legal documents rarely exceed 50MB. Larger limits require more server resources. Default: 50MB. Values above 100MB may cause upload timeouts on slower connections.

fields.warning: Increasing beyond 100MB may cause upload failures

fields.label: Cache Duration
fields.explanation: How long browsers cache static resources

tooltip.title: Cache Duration (Hours)
tooltip.content: Controls how long static resources are cached in browsers. Lower values ensure fresher data but increase server load. Recommended: 24 hours for balanced performance.

fields.warning: Values under 1 hour significantly increase server load

fields.label: Query Timeout

tooltip.title: Query Timeout (Seconds)
tooltip.content: Maximum time for database queries before timeout. Complex reports need longer timeouts. Too low: queries fail. Too high: resources tied up. Recommended: 30-60 seconds.

fields.warning: Values below 15s may cause complex report failures

fields.label: Response Compression
fields.explanation: Compress data before sending to browsers

tooltip.title: Enable Response Compression
tooltip.content: Compresses API responses before sending to browsers. Reduces bandwidth by 60-80% with slight CPU overhead. Recommended: Always enable unless debugging network issues.

fields.label: Backup Frequency
fields.explanation: How often automatic backups are created

tooltip.title: Automatic Backup Frequency
tooltip.content: Controls automatic backup schedule. Daily for production systems. Hourly for high-activity deployments. More frequent backups provide better recovery options but use more storage.

fields.label: Session Timeout

tooltip.title: Session Timeout (Minutes)
tooltip.content: Automatic logout after inactivity. Shorter = more secure but may frustrate users. Longer = convenient but higher unauthorized access risk. Industry standard: 30 minutes. Compliance may require 15-30 minutes.

fields.securityWarning: Values above 60 minutes may violate SOC 2 and ISO 27001 requirements

tooltip.title: Password Complexity Policy
tooltip.content: Low: 8+ characters. Medium: 8+ with special character (recommended). High: 12+ with mixed case and special. Higher complexity = more secure but harder to remember. Changes apply at next password change.

tooltip.title: Require Two-Factor Authentication
tooltip.content: When enabled, users must verify with a second factor (email/SMS code). Options: Disabled, Admin Only (recommended minimum), All Users. Significantly reduces unauthorized access risk.

fields.label: IP Address Whitelist

tooltip.title: IP Address Whitelist
tooltip.content: Restrict system access to specific IP addresses. One IP per line, CIDR notation supported (e.g., 192.168.1.0/24). Empty = all IPs allowed. TEST CAREFULLY before enabling.

fields.securityWarning: CRITICAL: Incorrect IPs can lock out ALL users including yourself. Ensure backend access before enabling.

fields.label: Failed Login Limit

tooltip.title: Failed Login Attempts Before Lockout
tooltip.content: Number of failed attempts before temporary account lockout. Lower = more secure against brute force. Higher = fewer support calls. Recommended: 5 attempts balances security with usability.

fields.warning: Values below 3 cause frequent lockouts from typos

fields.label: Lockout Duration
fields.explanation: How long locked accounts stay locked

tooltip.title: Account Lockout Duration (Minutes)
tooltip.content: How long accounts remain locked after exceeding failed login limit. Longer = better deterrence but more support burden. Recommended: 30 minutes deters attacks while allowing recovery.

tooltip.title: Password Expiry (Days)
tooltip.content: Days before users must change password. 0 = never expires. Regular rotation reduces compromised password risk. Recommended: 90 days for compliance, or 0 with strong 2FA.

tooltip.title: Email Provider Selection
tooltip.content: Gmail: Requires app password (not account password). Yahoo: App password required. Outlook: OAuth or app password. Custom SMTP: Full control over mail server. Test configuration before enabling for all users.

fields.label: Email App Password

tooltip.title: App Password (Not Account Password)
tooltip.content: Use a dedicated app-specific password, NOT your regular email password. Generate from your email provider's security settings. App passwords can be revoked independently for security.

fields.securityWarning: Never use your main account password. Generate app-specific password from provider security settings.

tooltip.title: Enable SMS Notifications
tooltip.content: Send text message alerts for hearings and deadlines. Requires SMS gateway configuration (Twilio, MSG91, etc.). Incurs per-message costs. Test before enabling organization-wide.

fields.label: Reminder Schedule
fields.explanation: Days before hearings to send reminders

tooltip.title: Hearing Reminder Schedule
tooltip.content: Comma-separated days before hearings to send reminders. Example: '1,3,7' sends reminders 7 days, 3 days, and 1 day before. Too many reminders may be ignored; too few may be missed.

fields.label: Case Number Format

tooltip.title: Case Number Format Pattern
tooltip.content: Pattern for auto-generating case IDs. Tokens: {YYYY}=year, {MM}=month, {####}=sequence. Example: 'CASE-{YYYY}-{####}' generates 'CASE-2025-0001'. Changes affect only NEW cases.

fields.warning: Changing format affects only new cases. Existing case numbers remain unchanged.

tooltip.title: Financial Year Start Month
tooltip.content: First month of your organization's financial year. April for India (Apr-Mar), January for international (Jan-Dec). Affects financial year display and some deadline calculations.

fields.label: Response SLA
fields.explanation: Target time to respond to queries

tooltip.title: Standard Response SLA (Hours)
tooltip.content: Target time to respond to client queries. Used for SLA tracking and escalation alerts. Industry standard: 24-48 hours for routine matters. Adjust based on capacity and client expectations.

tooltip.title: Calendar Integration Provider
tooltip.content: Google: Requires OAuth consent and Google Cloud setup. Microsoft: Azure AD application required. Both sync hearings bidirectionally. Calendar events include case references for context.

tooltip.title: Automatic Calendar Sync
tooltip.content: When enabled, hearings automatically sync to connected calendars in real-time. Manual mode: Sync on demand only. Auto-sync recommended for seamless calendar updates.

fields.label: GST Integration Mode

tooltip.title: GST Integration Mode
tooltip.content: Production: Real GST portal data - ensure credentials are correct. Sandbox: Test data only for development. Disabled: GST features turned off. Always test in Sandbox before switching to Production.

fields.warning: Production mode queries real GST portal - verify credentials first

tooltip.title: Document Storage Provider
tooltip.content: Local: Server filesystem (development only). Supabase: Lovable Cloud storage (recommended). AWS S3: Amazon cloud storage. Azure Blob: Microsoft cloud. Cloud storage recommended for production scalability.

fields.label: API Logging

tooltip.title: Enable API Request Logging
tooltip.content: Logs all external API calls for debugging integration issues. Useful for troubleshooting but may impact performance and use storage. Disable in production unless actively debugging.

fields.warning: May impact performance. Disable in production unless debugging.

fields.label: Production Mode

tooltip.title: Production Mode Toggle
tooltip.content: Enables production safeguards: Disables sample data generation, adds confirmation dialogs for destructive actions, enables full audit logging. Enable before go-live. Disable only for development/testing.

fields.warning: Disable only for development/testing environments

tooltip.title: Export All Data
tooltip.content: Downloads complete system data as JSON backup. Includes cases, clients, tasks, documents metadata (not files), and settings. Use for migration or disaster recovery. Always export before major changes.

fields.label: Import Data

tooltip.title: Import Data from Backup
tooltip.content: Restores data from previously exported JSON file. MERGES with existing data - does not replace. Test import on staging environment first. Duplicate handling based on record IDs.

fields.warning: Test import on staging environment first. Data is MERGED, not replaced.

fields.label: Clear All Data

tooltip.title: Clear All Data
tooltip.content: PERMANENTLY DELETES all cases, clients, tasks, documents, and settings. This action CANNOT BE UNDONE. Export backup first. Type confirmation required. Use only in development or when absolutely certain.

fields.securityWarning: IRREVERSIBLE ACTION - All data will be permanently deleted. Export backup before proceeding. Cannot be undone.

tooltip.title: Production Readiness Check
tooltip.content: Validates system configuration against production requirements: RLS policies enabled, authentication configured, backup scheduled, security settings validated, email tested. Address all issues before go-live.

fields.label: Authority Levels

tooltip.title: Legal Authority Hierarchy
tooltip.content: Defines the progression of legal authorities: Assessment → Adjudication → Tribunal → High Court → Supreme Court. Affects case categorization, appeal workflows, and statutory deadline calculations.

fields.warning: Deactivating a level hides it from forms but preserves existing case data

tooltip.title: Matter Type Configuration
tooltip.content: Sub-categories under authority levels (e.g., Tribunal → State Bench, Principal Bench). Enable 'Allows Matter Types' on the authority level first. Provides additional case classification granularity.

tooltip.title: Hearing Outcome Definitions
tooltip.content: Pre-defined outcomes for hearings: Adjourned, Order Reserved, Disposed, Part-Heard, etc. Standard outcomes enable consistent reporting and dashboard metrics. Custom outcomes can be added.

tooltip.title: Document Template Management
tooltip.content: Create and manage templates for letters, notices, and legal documents. Templates support variable placeholders ({{client_name}}, {{case_number}}) that auto-fill from case data during generation.

tooltip.title: Enable AI Features
tooltip.content: Master toggle for all AI-powered features including document analysis, case research, and assisted drafting. Uses Lovable AI supported models. No external API key required.

fields.label: AI Review Required
fields.explanation: Require human review of AI content

tooltip.title: Require Review Before Sending
tooltip.content: When enabled, AI-generated content must be reviewed by a human before delivery to clients. Strongly recommended for all client-facing communications to prevent AI hallucinations reaching clients.

fields.securityWarning: Disabling may result in unreviewed AI content reaching clients

fields.label: Audit Log Retention
fields.explanation: How long audit logs are kept

tooltip.title: Audit Log Retention (Days)
tooltip.content: How long security audit logs are retained. Longer retention = better compliance but more storage. Recommended: 365 days (1 year) for most compliance frameworks. Some regulations require 7-year retention.

fields.complianceNote: SOC 2, ISO 27001, HIPAA may require specific retention periods

tooltip.title: Save Settings
tooltip.content: Saves all configuration changes to the database. Most settings take effect immediately or on next page load. Critical settings (IP whitelist, production mode) may require confirmation.

buttons.label: Reset to Defaults

tooltip.title: Reset All Settings to Defaults
tooltip.content: Reverts all configuration to factory defaults. All custom configurations will be lost including email settings, integrations, and workflow rules. Document current settings before resetting.

buttons.warning: All custom configurations will be lost. Document settings before resetting.

tooltip.title: Test Email Configuration
tooltip.content: Sends a test email to the admin address to verify SMTP configuration is working correctly. Check inbox (and spam folder) for test message. Fix any errors before enabling email for all users.

tooltip.title: Connect Calendar
tooltip.content: Opens OAuth flow to connect Google Calendar or Microsoft Outlook. Grant calendar permissions when prompted. After connecting, select which calendar to sync hearings to.

tooltip.title: Run Production Readiness Check
tooltip.content: Validates all system configuration against production requirements. Generates report with passed checks, warnings, and errors. Address all issues before go-live. Re-run after fixes to verify.

fields.label: Authority Name
fields.explanation: Official name of the court or tribunal

tooltip.title: Legal Authority Name
tooltip.content: Full official name as it appears on orders and notifications. Example: 'Goods and Services Tax Appellate Tribunal, Mumbai Bench'. Used in all case documents and reports.

fields.systemDependency: Displayed on cases, hearings, and generated documents

fields.label: Authority Code
fields.explanation: Unique short code for the authority

tooltip.title: Authority Code
tooltip.content: Short unique identifier (e.g., 'GSTAT/MH/01', 'HC-DEL'). Used in case numbering, reports, and integrations. Once set and linked to cases, avoid changing.

fields.systemDependency: Referenced in case numbers and report filters

fields.label: Authority Level

tooltip.title: Authority Level (CRITICAL)
tooltip.content: Determines appellate hierarchy and applicable statutory deadlines. Options: AO (Assessing Officer), ADJ (Adjudicating Authority), AA (Appellate Authority), TRIB (Tribunal), HC (High Court), SC (Supreme Court). Wrong level = wrong deadline rules.

fields.systemDependency: Triggers statutory deadline rules, affects appeal forum calculation
fields.warning: Changing after cases linked may cause deadline recalculation issues

fields.label: Jurisdiction

tooltip.title: Jurisdiction
tooltip.content: Territorial or subject-matter coverage of this authority. Used for case routing and filtering. Example: 'Maharashtra', 'All India', 'Central Excise matters'.

fields.systemDependency: Affects case filtering and jurisdiction-based reports

fields.label: Matter Types
fields.explanation: Case categories handled at this authority

tooltip.title: Applicable Matter Types
tooltip.content: Types of cases this authority handles (GST, Income Tax, Customs, etc.). Controls which matter types appear when creating cases at this authority. Leave empty to allow all types.

fields.systemDependency: Filters matter type dropdown in case creation

fields.label: Bench Location

tooltip.title: Bench Location
tooltip.content: Physical address where hearings occur. Critical for GSTAT (multiple benches per state). Include full address for calendar invites and hearing preparation.

fields.systemDependency: Used in hearing venue and calendar integrations

fields.label: Status

tooltip.title: Authority Status
tooltip.content: Active: Shown in dropdowns, can link new cases. Inactive: Hidden from dropdowns, preserves existing case links. Use Inactive for closed or merged courts.

fields.systemDependency: Controls visibility in case creation dropdowns

tooltip.title: Digital Filing Support
tooltip.content: Indicates if this authority accepts electronic filings. Affects document submission workflow and compliance tracking. Enable only if court has official e-filing portal.

fields.label: Judge Name

tooltip.title: Judge Name
tooltip.content: Full name including honorific (e.g., 'Hon'ble Justice R.K. Sharma', 'Member (Technical) S. Gupta'). Appears on hearing records and case assignments.

fields.systemDependency: Displayed in hearings and case details

fields.label: Court Assignment
fields.explanation: Which Legal Authority this judge sits at

tooltip.title: Court Assignment (REQUIRED)
tooltip.content: The Legal Authority where this judge is currently assigned. Must exist in Legal Authorities master. Judge will only appear in hearing dropdowns for this court.

fields.systemDependency: Determines which hearing forms show this judge
fields.warning: Judge won't appear in dropdowns until court is assigned

fields.label: Specializations

tooltip.title: Judge Specializations
tooltip.content: Areas of legal expertise (Tax Law, Constitutional, Commercial, etc.). Based on actual case types heard, not general qualifications. Used for case-judge matching recommendations.

fields.systemDependency: Informs case strategy recommendations

fields.label: Bench

tooltip.title: Bench Assignment
tooltip.content: For courts with multiple benches (A, B, C or numbered). Affects hearing scheduling and cause list filtering. Update when bench reconstituted.

fields.systemDependency: Used in hearing scheduling and cause list

fields.label: Status

tooltip.title: Judge Status
tooltip.content: Active: Available for hearings. On Leave: Temporary absence. Transferred: Moved to different court. Retired: No longer serving. Elevated: Promoted to higher court. Affects dropdown visibility.

fields.systemDependency: Non-Active judges hidden from hearing forms
fields.warning: Always update status on transfer/retirement to prevent scheduling errors

fields.label: Appointment Date
fields.explanation: Date of appointment to current position

tooltip.title: Appointment Date
tooltip.content: When the judge was appointed to current position. Used to calculate years of service. Update when promoted or transferred.

fields.label: Contact Name

tooltip.title: Contact Name
tooltip.content: Full name as it should appear in communications. Include salutation for formal contacts (Mr./Ms./Dr.). Used in email salutations and document generation.

fields.systemDependency: Used in communications and document templates

fields.label: Link to Client
fields.explanation: Associate contact with a client organization

tooltip.title: Client Linkage
tooltip.content: Links this contact to a client organization. Client-linked contacts can receive portal access and inherit client visibility. Leave unlinked for standalone contacts (prospects, opposing counsel).

fields.systemDependency: Enables portal access, determines visibility
fields.warning: Verify correct client before linking - affects portal access

fields.label: Data Scope

tooltip.title: Contact Visibility (Data Scope)
tooltip.content: OWN: Only you can see this contact. TEAM: Your team can see. ALL: Everyone in organization can see. Applies mainly to standalone contacts; client-linked contacts inherit client visibility.

fields.systemDependency: Controls who sees this contact in lists and dropdowns

fields.label: Roles

tooltip.title: Contact Roles
tooltip.content: Signatory: Authorized to sign documents. Coordinator: Primary point of contact. Billing: Handles invoices. Decision Maker: Has authority on case matters. Assign all applicable roles.

fields.systemDependency: Affects signatory dropdowns, notification routing

fields.label: Primary Contact
fields.explanation: Main point of contact for client

tooltip.title: Primary Contact Flag
tooltip.content: When enabled, this contact receives key notifications and is shown first in contact lists. Each client should have exactly one primary contact. Verify identity before marking as primary.

fields.systemDependency: Receives important client notifications
fields.warning: Wrong person as primary = confidential info to wrong recipient

fields.label: Email Address

tooltip.title: Contact Email
tooltip.content: Primary email address for notifications and communications. Verify accuracy before saving - failed delivery affects deadline reminders. Use official business email, not personal.

fields.systemDependency: Used for all email notifications

fields.label: Portal Access

tooltip.title: Client Portal Access
tooltip.content: When enabled, contact can log into client portal to view their cases, documents, and communicate with team. CRITICAL: Verify identity before enabling. Only for client-linked contacts.

fields.systemDependency: Creates auth credentials and portal access
fields.warning: Wrong portal access = confidential data breach. Always verify identity first.

fields.label: Employee Name
fields.explanation: Full name of the team member

tooltip.title: Employee Name
tooltip.content: Full name as it should appear in the system. Used in case assignments, task routing, and audit logs. Keep consistent across all systems.

fields.systemDependency: Displayed in assignments, tasks, and audit trail

fields.label: Email
fields.explanation: Official email for login and notifications

tooltip.title: Employee Email
tooltip.content: Official email address used for login and receiving notifications. Must be unique. Update immediately if email changes - affects all notifications.

fields.systemDependency: Used for authentication and all notifications
fields.warning: Stale email = missed notifications

fields.label: Role

tooltip.title: Employee Role
tooltip.content: Admin: Full system access. Partner: Firm-wide view, most permissions. Manager: Team oversight, create permissions. Advocate: Case work, limited admin. Staff: Support, restricted access.

fields.systemDependency: Controls RBAC permissions across all modules
fields.warning: Over-privileged roles = security risk

fields.label: Data Scope
fields.explanation: What data this employee can see

tooltip.title: Data Scope (CRITICAL)
tooltip.content: OWN Cases: Only assigned cases. TEAM Cases: Assigned + team's cases (via hierarchy). ALL Cases: Every case in organization. Match to role: Partners=ALL, Managers=TEAM, Staff=OWN.

fields.systemDependency: Controls visibility of cases, tasks, clients across entire system
fields.warning: Wrong scope = can't see needed data OR sees too much

fields.label: Reports To

tooltip.title: Reporting Manager
tooltip.content: Who this employee reports to. CRITICAL for TEAM visibility - employees see their direct and indirect reports' cases. Partners typically report to themselves or leave blank.

fields.systemDependency: Determines Team Cases visibility chain
fields.warning: Missing manager = TEAM scope shows nothing extra

fields.label: Module Access

tooltip.title: Module Access
tooltip.content: Controls which modules appear in the employee's sidebar. Does NOT control permissions (that's via RBAC). Use to simplify interface for specific roles.

fields.systemDependency: Controls sidebar navigation only

fields.label: Active Status

tooltip.title: Active Status
tooltip.content: Active: Can log in and work. Inactive: Cannot log in, hidden from dropdowns, but record preserved for audit. ALWAYS deactivate departed employees, never delete.

fields.systemDependency: Controls login ability and dropdown visibility
fields.warning: Never delete employees - breaks audit trail

fields.label: Billable

tooltip.title: Billable Employee
tooltip.content: When enabled, time entries by this employee are included in billing calculations. Disable for support staff whose time isn't billed to clients.

fields.systemDependency: Affects time tracking and billing reports

fields.label: Event Type Name
fields.explanation: Descriptive name for this deadline type

tooltip.title: Event Type Name
tooltip.content: Clear name describing what triggers this deadline (e.g., 'ASMT-10 Reply', 'GSTAT Appeal Filing', 'Order Compliance'). Used in dropdowns and reports.

fields.systemDependency: Displayed in deadline selection and compliance reports

fields.label: Base Date Type
fields.explanation: Which date triggers the deadline countdown

tooltip.title: Base Date Type (CRITICAL)
tooltip.content: Which date starts the countdown: notice_date (date on notice), order_date (date order passed), receipt_date (date taxpayer received). Wrong selection = deadline off by weeks.

fields.systemDependency: Starting point for all deadline calculations
fields.warning: Wrong base_date_type is #1 cause of deadline errors

fields.label: Deadline Type

tooltip.title: Deadline Type
tooltip.content: days: Calendar days including weekends. working_days: Excludes holidays (requires current calendar). months: Calendar months. Match to statutory language exactly.

fields.systemDependency: Determines calculation method
fields.warning: working_days requires up-to-date holiday calendar

fields.label: Deadline Count
fields.explanation: Number of days/months from base date

tooltip.title: Deadline Count (CRITICAL)
tooltip.content: Number from the statute (e.g., 30 for 30-day reply period). This is the core deadline limit. Verify against current legislation - limits change.

fields.systemDependency: The actual statutory limit applied to cases
fields.warning: Wrong count = miscalculated deadlines, potential non-compliance

fields.label: Authority Level
fields.explanation: Which forum this deadline applies to

tooltip.title: Applicable Authority Level
tooltip.content: Which level of authority this deadline applies to (AO, ADJ, AA, TRIB, HC, SC). Same event type may have different limits at different levels.

fields.systemDependency: Matches deadline rule to case's authority level

fields.label: Extension Allowed

tooltip.title: Extension Allowed
tooltip.content: When enabled, deadline can be extended via extension request workflow. Some statutory deadlines cannot be extended (hard deadlines). Check statute before enabling.

fields.systemDependency: Controls extension request availability

fields.label: Legal Reference

tooltip.title: Legal Reference
tooltip.content: Section/Rule citation for audit trail (e.g., 'Section 73(10) CGST Act, 2017', 'Rule 36(4)'). Required for compliance documentation.

fields.systemDependency: Audit trail for statutory compliance

fields.label: Auto-Create Task

tooltip.title: Auto-Create Compliance Task
tooltip.content: When enabled, system automatically creates a task when this deadline is triggered. Task includes deadline date and responsible party. Ensures nothing falls through cracks.

fields.systemDependency: Creates tasks in task management module

operations.description: Tooltips for operational modules: Case Management, Hearings, Tasks, Documents, Timeline, AI Assistant, Communications

tooltip.title: SLA Status Indicator
tooltip.content: Color-coded compliance status. 🟢 Green: On track, plenty of time. 🟡 Yellow: Approaching deadline (50%+ elapsed). 🔴 Red: Deadline breached or imminent. Click to see deadline details.

tooltip.title: Case Stage
tooltip.content: Legal stage of the case (Assessment, Adjudication, Tribunal, High Court, etc.). Stage determines applicable deadlines, workflows, and checklists. Click to see stage history.

fields.label: Advance Stage
fields.explanation: Move case to next litigation stage

tooltip.title: Advance Stage
tooltip.content: ⚠️ Moves case to next stage in lifecycle. Action is logged but NOT reversible except through formal Remand. Verify all prerequisites are complete before advancing.

tooltip.title: Hearing Outcome Types
tooltip.content: Adjourned: Postponed to future date. Order Reserved: Arguments done, order pending. Order Passed: Decision issued. Part Heard: To continue. Disposed: Case concluded. Select appropriate outcome to trigger correct follow-up actions.

tooltip.title: Hearing Conflict Warning
tooltip.content: ⚠️ This hearing overlaps with another scheduled hearing for the same advocate. Review calendar and reschedule one of the conflicting hearings to avoid attendance issues.

tooltip.title: Task Status States
tooltip.content: Backlog: Created, not scheduled. To Do: Ready to start. In Progress: Actively working. In Review: Awaiting approval. Blocked: External dependency. Done: Completed. Cancelled: No longer needed.

tooltip.title: Escalation Level
tooltip.content: Indicates how overdue this task is. Level 1: 1-3 days overdue (yellow). Level 2: 4-7 days (orange). Level 3: 7+ days (red). Higher levels notify more senior staff and may require manager intervention.

tooltip.title: Automation Triggers
tooltip.content: Events that fire automation rules: Case Created, Stage Changed, Hearing Scheduled, Hearing Concluded, Document Uploaded, Deadline Approaching. Rule executes when trigger matches conditions.

tooltip.title: Document Categories
tooltip.content: Notice: Demand/SCN. Reply: Submissions. Order: Court decisions. Petition: Appeals. Evidence: Supporting docs. Correspondence: Letters. Internal: Memos/notes. Categorization enables filtering and proper organization.

tooltip.title: Document Versioning
tooltip.content: Version number (v1, v2, etc.) tracks document revisions. Upload new versions to keep history. All versions preserved for audit. Current version marked with badge. Click to view version history.

tooltip.title: Client Portal Visibility
tooltip.content: ⚠️ When enabled, client can see this document in their portal. Review content before enabling. Internal notes should NEVER be portal visible. Verify permissions before sharing sensitive documents.

tooltip.title: Timeline Entry Types
tooltip.content: Auto-generated from system events (hearings, tasks, documents). Manual entries: Milestone (significant event) or Note (internal comment). Auto-entries are read-only for audit integrity.

tooltip.title: AI Assistant Context
tooltip.content: AI has access to current case data: details, timeline, hearings, documents. Cannot access other cases or external databases. For cross-case analysis, provide relevant info in your prompt.

tooltip.title: Message Delivery Status
tooltip.content: Pending: Queued. Sent: Left our server. Delivered: Reached recipient server. Read: Opened (if read receipts enabled). Failed: Could not deliver. Bounced: Invalid address.

tooltip.title: Template Variables
tooltip.content: Placeholders like {{client_name}}, {{case_number}} auto-fill from case data. Variables must match exactly. Preview message before sending to verify all variables resolved correctly.

tooltip.title: Bulk Operation Filters
tooltip.content: Apply filters before bulk actions to target specific items. Always review count before executing. Bulk actions are logged but may not be easily reversible. Double-check filter results.

tooltip.title: Data Scope Filter
tooltip.content: My Cases: Only your assigned items. Team Cases: Your team's items (based on hierarchy). All Cases: Everything you have permission to see. Filter affects list and counts.

tooltip.title: Quick Actions
tooltip.content: Frequently used actions accessible with one click. Keyboard shortcuts also available (hover for shortcut key). Use quick actions to speed up common workflows.

tooltip.title: Export Formats
tooltip.content: PDF: Best for final documents, preserves formatting. Excel: For data analysis and manipulation. CSV: Simple data export. Choose based on how you'll use the exported data.

tooltip.title: Calendar Synchronization
tooltip.content: Sync hearings to external calendars (Google, Outlook). Enable in Settings > Integrations. Once connected, hearings auto-sync. Click calendar icon on hearing for manual sync/download.

tooltip.title: Quick Add Case
tooltip.content: Shortcut to create a new case directly from dashboard. Opens case creation form with essential fields. Use for rapid case intake.

tooltip.title: Quick Add Hearing
tooltip.content: Shortcut to schedule a hearing directly from dashboard. Select case, date, and court. Creates hearing and optional calendar sync.

tooltip.title: Quick Add Task
tooltip.content: Shortcut to create a task directly from dashboard. Assign to yourself or team member. Link to case or create standalone task.

tooltip.title: Case Entry
tooltip.content: Each row shows case number, client, status, and next action date. Click to open details. Use row actions menu for quick operations.

tooltip.title: Create New Case
tooltip.content: Opens case creation wizard. Required fields: title, client, case type. System auto-generates case number. Assign team and set priority.

tooltip.title: Case Tabs
tooltip.content: Switch between case views: Overview (summary), Lifecycle (stages), Timeline (history), Documents, Tasks, Hearings, Communications.

tooltip.title: Hearing Entry
tooltip.content: Shows date, time, court, judge, and case. Color indicates status: upcoming (blue), today (orange), past (gray). Click for details.

tooltip.title: Schedule Hearing
tooltip.content: Opens hearing scheduler. Select case, date/time, court, and judge. System checks for conflicts. Set reminders and preparation tasks.

tooltip.title: Record Hearing Outcome
tooltip.content: After hearing, record the result: Adjourned, Order Passed, Dismissed, etc. Triggers follow-up tasks and updates case timeline.

tooltip.title: Task Entry
tooltip.content: Shows title, assignee, due date, and status. Color coding: overdue (red), due soon (amber), on track (green). Drag to change status.

tooltip.title: Create Task
tooltip.content: Opens task form. Enter title, description, due date. Link to case, assign to user, set priority. Use templates for common tasks.

tooltip.title: Document List
tooltip.content: Shows files with name, type, upload date, and uploader. Sort by any column. Click to preview/download. Use filters to find documents.

tooltip.title: Upload Document
tooltip.content: Add files to case. Drag-drop or browse. Select category and folder. Multiple files supported. Max size: 25MB per file.

tooltip.title: Search Clients
tooltip.content: Find clients by name, GSTIN, PAN, or email. Partial matches supported. Use filters for client type or status.

tooltip.title: GSTIN Autofill
tooltip.content: Enter 15-digit GSTIN, click fetch icon. System retrieves legal name and registered address from government database. Verify before saving.

tooltip.title: Communication Channels
tooltip.content: Filter messages by channel: Email, SMS, Internal Notes. Each channel has different delivery and visibility rules.

tooltip.title: Report Types
tooltip.content: Choose report category: Cases, Hearings, Tasks, Performance, Financial, Compliance. Each has predefined and custom options.

tooltip.title: Add Master Data
tooltip.content: Create new entry in master table. Fill required fields, use consistent naming. Master data affects all linked cases.

tooltip.title: General Settings
tooltip.content: Configure firm name, logo, timezone, and display preferences. Changes affect all users. Review before saving.

tooltip.title: Role Assignment
tooltip.content: Assign role to employee. Role determines permissions and data access. Changes take effect immediately for logged-in users.

tooltip.title: Data Import
tooltip.content: Upload data from Excel/CSV. Download template, fill data, upload, map columns, validate, import. Test with small batches first.

tooltip.title: Data Export
tooltip.content: Download data for backup or analysis. Select entity, apply filters, choose format (Excel/CSV/JSON). Schedule for recurring exports.

tooltip.title: Profile Settings
tooltip.content: Update your avatar, password, notification preferences, and display settings. Changes apply to your account only.
